Alternate translation: "You are always faithful to your covenant and are worthy of people trusting you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: Covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness come before you

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here people living their lives is spoken of as if they were walking. Alternate translation: "they live" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: they walk

contextId.occurrenceNote: The writer speaks of Yahweh acting favorably towards them as if Yahweh's face shone a light on them. Alternate translation: "knowing that you act favorably towards them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: in the light of your face

contextId.occurrenceNote: The king who protects his people and whom Yahweh chose is spoken of as if he were a shield that belongs to Yahweh. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: For our shield belongs to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: God always being loyal and doing what he promises for David is spoken of as if truth and faithfulness were objects that would be with David. contextId.glQuote: My truth and my covenant faithfulness will be with him

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh protecting and saving David is spoken of as if Yahweh were a high rock that David could stand on top of for protection from enemies. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: the rock of my salvation

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh giving David special rank and privileges over all other people is spoken of as if David would be Yahweh's firstborn son. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: I also will place him as my firstborn son

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh speaks of continuing to act faithfully towards David is spoken of as if Yahweh's covenant faithfulness were an object that he extends or makes longer. Alternate translation: "I will continue to act faithfully towards him forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: I will extend my covenant faithfulness to him forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: God punishing David's descendants is spoken of as if he would hit them with a rod. The abstract noun "rebellion" can be stated as a verb. contextId.glQuote: punish their rebellion with a rod

contextId.occurrenceNote: God punishing David's descendants is spoken of as if God would literally hit them. This can be stated as a complete sentence. Alternate translation: "I will punish them because they sinned against me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: their iniquity with blows

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh completely humiliating the king is spoken of as if shame were a garment that God used to cover the king. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: covered him with shame

contextId.occurrenceNote: God not helping the king is spoken of as if God were hiding from him. Alternate translation: "Will you refuse to help the king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: Will you hide yourself

contextId.occurrenceNote: The enemies shouting insults at the king is spoken of as if insults were an object that the enemies throw violently at the king. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: Your enemies hurl insults

contextId.occurrenceNote: God protecting his people is spoken of as if God were a refuge or shelter. Alternate translation: "Lord, you have been like a shelter for us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: Lord, you have been our refuge

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here sight represents judgment or evaluation. Alternate translation: "to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
